word: I have seen for a long time that the apprentices in our publishing houses have not received sufficient attention. [IN ORDER TO PROVIDE A PRACTICAL TRAINING IN THE AREAS OF WRITING, EDITORIAL WORK, AND PUBLIC RELATIONS, A PROGRAM OF ON-THE-JOB TRAINING HAS BEEN COOPERATIVELY ESTABLISHED BY THE GENERAL CONFERENCE.--GENERAL CONFERENCE PUBLISHING DEPARTMENT POLICIES, 43.] It is not enough to see that they work the stated number of hours in the office. Connected with their work there should be hours for education. Studies should be taken up and lessons given at appointed times. . . .
